title: Marnie Simpson reveals she has smashed her house up in lengthy Snapchat rant following Lewis Bloor’s Valentine’s Day betrayal
text:
Marnie Simpson has taken to Snapchat to talk about her split from Lewis Bloor Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 Marnie lay in bed as she poured her heart out on Snapchat 
Taking to Snapchat on Tuesday night, a distraught Marnie opened up about how she felt after discovering the extent of Lewis’ deceit. 
She said: “I don’t normally do videos but I feel like I want to get my point across about what the hell’s just happened. 
“I was filming Geordie Shore for three weeks with no contact with the outside world, no phone, so I haven’t been able to contact anyone. Getty Images - WireImage 21 Marnie has been left devastated by Lewis’ betrayal 
“On Valentines night I was really upset, so I sent Lewis a lovely Valentine’s card, like three pages long.” 
The next day Marnie tried to call her boyfriend while she had a down day from the MTV reality show, but couldn’t get through to him. 
She said: “I thought that’s weird as he was at Drake last night. Fame Flynet 21 The former couple met on Celebrity Big Brother last summer 
“I had this gut feeling. Then he finally answered hours later and told me he hadn’t had any missed calls and I thought ‘that’s weird I’ve rang you 10 times.’ 
“On the phone he was like ‘oh my god baby I miss you so much, I cannot wait for you to come back to our home like it’s been so hard without you’.” Snapchat/MarnieGshore Marnie looked drained as she spoke to the camera Snapchat/MarnieGshore Marnie explained what had happened since she left the Geordie Shore house 
Marnie added Lewis had even sent a bouquet of roses to her in the Geordie Shore house. 
She said: “Talking to me literally as he’s leaving the hotel where he’s shagged this girl, I can’t actually get my head around it. Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 Marnie called herself a mug at one point 
“From the minute I came out of Geordie Shore and got my phone back I got a message that told me what was happening and that there was a video going round. 
“So obviously me and Lewis were over from that second.” Getty Images Marnie was away filming Geordie Shore and had no contact with the outside world Lewis Bloor cheats on Marnie Simpson on VALENTINE'S DAY with girl he met in carpark 
Marnie then explained how she needed to get her Range Rover back off her boyfriend, as he was driving it while she was away filming. 
She added: "What a mug. I should have mug written there, in fact he’s probably dropped the girl off in my Range Rover, I wouldn’t put it past him." 
Marnie claimed she didn't let on to Lewis that she knew about his liaison, and got him to drive the car back to her. related stories 'F***ing scumbag' Marnie Simpson lashes out at ex Lewis Bloor after he cheated on her on Valentine's Day 'ALL GOOD THINGS...' 'Heartbroken' Marnie Simpson and Lewis Bloor hint they've split again in emotional tweets 'MUST REALLY LOVE HIM' Geordie Shore's Marnie Simpson says Lauren Goodger 'might be making a mistake' dating jailbird GEORDIE AFTERMATH Geordie Shore's Gaz Beadle gives fans a disgusting sneak peek inside his bedroom 
She said: "At this point I had only seen him in the car with the girls, I hadn’t seen it in the hotel room. 
"So when he got to my house he swore down on his family’s lives that nothing else happened and he just dropped her off at his own house. Getty Images - WireImage 21 The couple looked loved up at the National Television Awards last month 
"Because I love him, well I loved him, I wanted to believe that tiny bit of hope that he was telling the truth that he just went home. 
"Then he left and I’ve been crying all day long, really upset, but even maybe thinking maybe I could forgive him because he didn’t actually do anything in the first video." 
But after The Sun Online revealed the full extent of what happened between Lewis and the girl, Ammelia Gueste, Marnie saw red. Snapchat/MarnieGshore Marnie said she had been crying all day after seeing the new video Marnie Simpson reveals deeps feelings for Celebrity Big Brother beau Lewis Bloor 
She said: "Then tonight I get the worst feeling I’ve ever experienced when I saw the video of him in bed with the girl. 
"I can’t actually believe it. I’ve cried, I’ve screamed, I’ve smashed my house up. Every emotion, I’m still in shock. Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 Marnie said the feeling she felt most at the moment is anger 
"I’ve never been cheated on until now, it’s the first time I’ve experienced what it feels like, it is awful, its horrendous." 
Marnie then claimed the worst bit of the whole situation was how she had provided for the former Towie star throughout their romance. Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 The star fretted that her entire relationship with Lewis had been a lie 
She claimed: "The worst thing about this for me is that I literally I provide for Lewis, I have for practically the last eight months, I have literally done everything I can. 
"Thousands, thousands he’s had out of me. Then he has the audacity to tell the girl that he’s only with me for the money. 
"He also told the girl that he was going to pick me up on Monday but keep Friday and Saturday free to take her out. Fame Flynet 21 Marnie feels like a mug for not realising what Lewis was doing 
While he’s just living in the house that I paid for, driving round in my Range Rover he’s just kindly sh***ing girls on Valentine’s Day." 
Marnie then added how she had felt they were in "such a good place" before their split, and was devastated to learn that he had admitted to Ammelia he was only with Marnie "for the money". Snapchat/MarnieGshore Marnie covered her face at one point during her lengthy Snapchat posts Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 Marnie said she wanted to expose Lewis for who he really was 
She added: "I’ve literally just spent seven months of my life with an absolute phoney, a lying cheating scumbag." 
Marnie then turned her attention to the girls in the videos, thanking them for opening her eyes to what Lewis is really like. 
She said: "If it wasn’t for you girls I would have spent maybe another year with this guy and never know. Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 The star also thanked the girls for showing Lewis for what he really was 
"The thing is there is only one thing I feel right now and that is probably anger, I’ve cried all the tears I can cry I don’t think I’ve got any left." 
But as Marnie started to thank her loyal fans for the support they had showered on her via social media since the story broke, the star choked up once more. Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 Marnie said she had initially considered giving Lewis another chance until she saw the second video 
She said: "I want to expose him for what he actually is and what he’s actually done. 
I want to say a massive thank you for everyone who is there for me and sending lots of support. Snapchat/MarnieGshore Marnie doesn't understand how Lewis could send her Valentine's flowers after what he had done behind her back 
"It literally means the world. It makes me feel so good when I feel so low. 
"Just sometimes these situations when you’re cheated on makes you feel like it’s something you’ve done but all the messages have made me realise that it’s not me, just boys can’t change." Snapchat/MarnieGshore The star also spoke about how she had found it easy to remain faithful despite filming with ex-boyfriend Aaron Chalmers Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 Marnie was still in shock at the night's revelations 
Marnie then pointed out she had managed to stay faithful while in the Geordie Shore house despite being in close proximity to her ex-boyfriend, Aaron Chalmers. 
She said: "Also one more thing, I’ve just did a 12 episode series of Geordie Shore with my ex boyfriend who I was quite serious with and I was able to keep my knickers on why couldn’t he? Snapchat/MarnieGshore 21 The star choked up a bit as she thanked her fans for their support 
"The thing is when you love someone it’s not a hard thing to stay faithful, I find it really easy to stay faithful when I love them but some people aren’t real, they’re fake and pretend that they’re in love with you when they’re really not. Sad." 
The Sun Online has contacted a representative for Lewis for comment.
